title: Rear Suspension Units - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Raise and support the motorcycle so that the rear wheel is clear of the ground.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DUB; DTB; DTC; DU4; DT4; DB4

body.body: If both suspension units are to be removed, place a block beneath the rear wheel to prevent it dropping when the second unit is removed.
Note the orientation of the rear suspension units for installation.
Loosen and remove the upper and lower mounting bolts and washers then remove the suspension unit from its mounting spigots. Collect the washers and discard the bolts.
Repeat step 1 for the other rear suspension unit (if required).
